solution.text:
Given equation :
\((x+_{{l+k}}_)^3\times (x-_{{l+(5*k)}}_) = (x-_{k}_)^2\times (x+_{l}_)^2\)
Solving this equation as follows:
First expand \((x+_{{l+k}}_)^3\) as \(x^3 + _{{pow((l+k),3)}}_ + _{{3*(l+k)}}_x^2 + _{{3*(pow((l+k),2))}}_x\)
Similarly,
\((x-_{k}_)^2 = x^2 + _{{pow(k,2)}}_ - _{{2*k}}_x\)
\((x+_{l}_)^2 = x^2 + _{{pow(l,2)}}_ + _{{2*l}}_x\)
Now, substituting these expanded for in given equation.
We get :
\((x^3 + _{{pow((l+k),3)}}_ + _{{3*(l+k)}}_x^2 + _{{3*(pow((l+k),2))}}_x)\times (x-_{{l+(5*k)}}_) = (x^2 + _{{pow(k,2)}}_ - _{{2*k}}_x)\times (x^2 + _{{pow(l,2)}}_ + _{{2*l}}_x)\)
Solving further we get :
\(x^4 + _{{2*(l-k)}}_x^3 - _{{12*k*(l+k)}}_x^2 - _{{pow((l+k),2)*((2*l)+(13*k))}}_x - _{{(pow((l+k),3))*(l+(5*k))}}_ = x^4 + _{{2*(l-k)}}_x^3 - _{{-pow(l,2)-pow(k,2)+(4*k*l)}}_x^2 - _{{2*k*l*(l-k)}}_x + _{{(pow((l*k),2))}}_\)
Since \(x^4\) and \(x^3\) terms are getting cancelled from both side.
Hence given equation is quadratic equation
